edu.rit.gpu

Interface Kernel


  • public interface Kernel
    Interface Kernel specifies the base interface for a GPU kernel function. To use a GPU kernel function:

    1. Write the C or C++ code for a CUDA module containing one or more kernel functions to be executed on the GPU. The kernel function(s) must be declared to use "C" call syntax; for example:
          extern "C" __global__ void foo (...)
      Compile the CUDA module using the nvcc compiler.

    2. For each kernel function in the CUDA module, write a separate Java interface, as follows.
      • The interface name can be whatever you want.
      • The interface must extend interface Kernel.
      • The interface must declare one and only one method.
      • The method's name must be identical to that of the kernel function. Suppose the method's name is foo.
      • The foo method must return void.
      • The foo method's arguments must appear in the same order as those of the kernel function.
      • Declare each foo method argument's data type to correspond with the kernel function argument's data type as listed in the table below. (Kernel function arguments of other types are not supported at this time.)

        Java data type C data type
        boolean int
        byte char, unsigned char
        char unsigned short int
        short short int, unsigned short int
        int int, unsigned int
        long long long int, unsigned long long int
        float float
        double double
        GpuByteArray char*, unsigned char*
        GpuShortArray short int*, unsigned short int*
        GpuIntArray int*, unsigned int*
        GpuLongArray long long int*, unsigned long long int*
        GpuFloatArray float*
        GpuDoubleArray double*
        GpuByteMatrix char**, unsigned char**
        GpuShortMatrix short int**, unsigned short int**
        GpuIntMatrix int**, unsigned int**
        GpuLongMatrix long long int**, unsigned long long int**
        GpuFloatMatrix float**
        GpuDoubleMatrix double**
        GpuStructVbl struct T*
        GpuStructArray struct T*

    3. Call the getModule() method on a Gpu object, specifying the name of the compiled CUDA module file relative to the Java class path. This returns a Module object.

    4. Suppose the kernel function interface is named Bar. Call the getKernel() method on the Module object, as follows:
          Bar proxy = module.getKernel (Bar.class);
      This returns a reference to a proxy object that implements interface Bar.

    5. Configure the kernel by calling the setGridDim(), setBlockDim(), setCacheConfig(), and setDynamicSharedMemorySize() methods on the Bar proxy object as necessary.

    6. Set the contents of any input variables (instances of GpuVbl subclasses), and transfer these from host to device.

    7. Launch the kernel by calling the foo method on the Bar proxy object, passing in the desired argument values. The foo method returns when the kernel finishes.

    8. Transfer any output variables (instances of GpuVbl subclasses) from device to host, and examine their contents.

    Study the source code of the classes in package edu.rit.pj2.example to see examples of Parallel Java 2 GPU programs.

    Note: A class that implements interface Kernel is not multiple thread safe. It is assumed that only one thread at a time will call methods on a Kernel object.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setBlockDim(int blockDimX)
      Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with a one-dimensional block.
      void setBlockDim(int blockDimX, int blockDimY)
      Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with a two-dimensional block.
      void setBlockDim(int blockDimX, int blockDimY, int blockDimZ)
      Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with a three-dimensional block.

      Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with the given cache configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • setGridDim

        void setGridDim(int gridDimX)
        Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with a one-dimensional grid. If not specified, the default is a one-dimensional grid with gridDimX = 1.
        Parameters:
        gridDimX - Grid X dimension (≥ 1).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if gridDimX < 1.
        See Also:
        setGridDim(int,int), setGridDim(int,int,int)

      • setGridDim

        void setGridDim(int gridDimX,
              int gridDimY)
        Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with a two-dimensional grid. If not specified, the default is a one-dimensional grid with gridDimX = 1.
        Parameters:
        gridDimX - Grid X dimension (≥ 1).
        gridDimY - Grid Y dimension (≥ 1).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if gridDimX < 1 or gridDimY < 1.
        See Also:
        setGridDim(int), setGridDim(int,int,int)

      • setGridDim

        void setGridDim(int gridDimX,
              int gridDimY,
              int gridDimZ)
        Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with a three-dimensional grid. If not specified, the default is a one-dimensional grid with gridDimX = 1.
        Parameters:
        gridDimX - Grid X dimension (≥ 1).
        gridDimY - Grid Y dimension (≥ 1).
        gridDimZ - Grid Z dimension (≥ 1).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if gridDimX < 1 or gridDimY < 1 or gridDimZ < 1.
        See Also:
        setGridDim(int), setGridDim(int,int)

      • setBlockDim

        void setBlockDim(int blockDimX)
        Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with a one-dimensional block. If not specified, the default is a one-dimensional block with blockDimX = 1.
        Parameters:
        blockDimX - Block X dimension (≥ 1).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if blockDimX < 1.
        See Also:
        setBlockDim(int,int), setBlockDim(int,int,int)

      • setBlockDim

        void setBlockDim(int blockDimX,
               int blockDimY)
        Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with a two-dimensional block. If not specified, the default is a one-dimensional block with blockDimX = 1.
        Parameters:
        blockDimX - Block X dimension (≥ 1).
        blockDimY - Block Y dimension (≥ 1).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if blockDimX < 1 or blockDimY < 1.
        See Also:
        setBlockDim(int), setBlockDim(int,int,int)

      • setBlockDim

        void setBlockDim(int blockDimX,
               int blockDimY,
               int blockDimZ)
        Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with a three-dimensional block. If not specified, the default is a one-dimensional block with blockDimX = 1.
        Parameters:
        blockDimX - Block X dimension (≥ 1).
        blockDimY - Block Y dimension (≥ 1).
        blockDimZ - Block Z dimension (≥ 1).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if blockDimX < 1 or blockDimY < 1 or blockDimZ < 1.
        See Also:
        setBlockDim(int), setBlockDim(int,int)

      • setCacheConfig

        void setCacheConfig(CacheConfig config)
        Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with the given cache configuration. If not specified, the default is to use the GPU's cache configuration setting.
        Parameters:
        config - Cache configuration.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if config is null.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        Gpu.setCacheConfig(CacheConfig)

      • setDynamicSharedMemorySize

        void setDynamicSharedMemorySize(int bytesize)
        Specify that this kernel function will be invoked with the given dynamic shared memory size. If not specified, the default is 0.
        Parameters:
        bytesize - Number of dynamic shared memory bytes (≥ 0).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if bytesize < 0.
